00024 
00025 void MCGeometry::addSurface( const unsigned int surfaceId,
00026                                     const Quadric& inQuadric)
00027 {
00028     Insist(surfaceId > 0, "Things will break if surfaceId = 0 is allowed.");
00029 
00030     // (the return value from "insert" has a weird type)
00031     typedef std::pair<SurfaceMap::iterator, bool> ReturnedPair;
00032 
00033     // "clone" calls a routine in the quadric which allocates new memory
00034     // WE ARE NOW RESPONSIBLE FOR THIS MEMORY (and must delete it when
00035     // appropriate)
00036     Quadric* newQuadric = inQuadric.clone();
00037 
00038     ReturnedPair result =
00039         _surfaces.insert( std::make_pair(surfaceId, newQuadric) );
00040 
00041     // check return value to make sure surfaceId was not already taken
00042     Insist(result.second == true,
00043             "Tried to add a surface with an ID that was already there.");
00044 
00045 
00046     // **** temporary code? ****
00047     _surfaceIds.insert( std::make_pair(newQuadric, surfaceId) );
00048 
00049 }

00051 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00052 void MCGeometry::addCell(const unsigned int cellId, const IntVec surfaceIds)
00053 {
00054     typedef std::pair<CellMap::iterator, bool>      CMReturnedPair;
00055     typedef std::pair<SCConnectMap::iterator, bool> SCCMReturnedPair;
00056 
00057     //---- convert surface ID to pairs of unsigned ints (surfaceIds) and bools
00058     //                                                  (surface sense) -----//
00059     QASVec boundingSurfaces;
00060 
00061     // bounding surfaces should have same length as input list of surface IDs
00062     // so from the start just reserve that many spaces in memory
00063     boundingSurfaces.reserve(surfaceIds.size());
00064 
00065 
00066     // -------- ITERATE OVER INPUT SURFACE LIST -------- //
00067     
00068     for (IntVec::const_iterator it = surfaceIds.begin();
00069                                 it != surfaceIds.end(); ++it) {
00070         unsigned int userSurfaceId; //an integer that only the user deals with
00071         QuadricAndSense newSurface;
00072 
00073         if (*it > 0) // user inputs a positive value (positive sense surface)
00074         {
00075             userSurfaceId     = *it;
00076             newSurface.second = true;
00077         }
00078         else // user input a negative value (negative surface sense)
00079         {
00080             userSurfaceId     = -(*it);
00081             newSurface.second = false;
00082         }
00083 
00084         // translate the user's given surface ID to a Quadric pointer
00085         SurfaceMap::iterator findSMResult = 
00086             _surfaces.find(userSurfaceId);
00087 
00088         if (findSMResult == _surfaces.end()) {
00089             Insist(0,
00090             "FATAL ERROR: this cell references a surface that does not exist.");
00091         }
00092         // the value from the find result is the pointer to the Quadric
00093         newSurface.first = findSMResult->second;
00094 
00095         // add the surface to the vector of bounding surfaces
00096         boundingSurfaces.push_back(newSurface);
00097 
00098         // this counts as another unmatched surface
00099         _unMatchedSurfaces++;
00100 //        cout << "Added surface " << userSurfaceId << " to cell " << cellId
00101 //             << " (unmatched surface count: " << _unMatchedSurfaces << ")"
00102 //             << endl;
00103     }
00104 
00105     Check(surfaceIds.size() == boundingSurfaces.size());
00106 
00107     // TODO: make sure surfaces inside each cell are unique (no duplications or
00108     // having both plus and minus)
00109 
00110     //====== add cell to the map
00111     Cell* newCell = new Cell(boundingSurfaces, cellId);
00112     CMReturnedPair result =
00113         _cells.insert( std::make_pair(cellId, newCell) );
00114 
00115     // check return value to make sure surfaceId was not already taken
00116     Insist(result.second == true,
00117             "Tried to add a cell with an ID that was already there.");
00118 
00119     //====== loop back through the surfaces and add the connectivity
00120     for (QASVec::iterator bsIt = boundingSurfaces.begin();
00121                           bsIt != boundingSurfaces.end(); ++bsIt)
00122     {
00123         QuadricAndSense &newQandS = *bsIt;
00124 
00125         // using the "associative array" capability of maps lets us access a
00126         // key, and it will either automatically initialize an empty vector or
00127         // return the vector that is already  
00128         // see C++ Standard Library pp. 182-183
00129         _surfToCellConnectivity[newQandS].push_back(newCell);
00130     }
00131 }

00133 void MCGeometry::debugPrint() const
00134 {
00135     //-------------- PRINT SURFACES ----------------//
00136     cout << "SURFACES: " << endl;
00137     SurfaceMap::const_iterator itSur = _surfaces.begin();
00138     
00139     while (itSur != _surfaces.end()) {
00140         cout << " SURFACE " << itSur->first << ": "
00141              << *(itSur->second) << endl;
00142         ++itSur;
00143     }
00144 
00145     //-------------- PRINT CELLS TO SURFACES ----------------//
00146     cout << "CELLS: " << endl;
00147     CellMap::const_iterator celIt = _cells.begin();
00148     
00149     while (celIt != _cells.end()) {
00150         cout << " CELL " << celIt->first << ": ";
00151 
00152         // query cell for surface pointers
00153         const QASVec& boundingSurfaces = celIt->second->getBoundingSurfaces();
00154 
00155         QASVec::const_iterator bsIt = boundingSurfaces.begin();
00156 
00157         while (bsIt != boundingSurfaces.end()) {
00158 
00159             _printQAS(*bsIt);
00160             cout << " ";
00161 
00162             ++bsIt;
00163         }
00164 
00165         cout << endl;
00166         ++celIt;
00167     }
00168 
00169     cout << "SURFACES TO CELLS: " << endl;
00170     //-------------- PRINT SURFACES TO CELLS ----------------//
00171     SCConnectMap::const_iterator surfToCellIt = _surfToCellConnectivity.begin();
00172     
00173     while (surfToCellIt != _surfToCellConnectivity.end()) {
00174         // print the surface and orientation
00175         cout << " ";
00176 
00177         _printQAS(surfToCellIt->first);
00178 
00179         cout << ": ";
00180         
00181         // print the cells
00182         const CellVec& theCells = surfToCellIt->second;
00183 
00184         CellVec::const_iterator cIt = theCells.begin();
00185         while (cIt != theCells.end()) {
00186             cout << (*cIt)->getUserId() << " ";
00187 
00188             ++cIt;
00189         }
00190 
00191         cout << endl;
00192         ++surfToCellIt;
00193     }
00194 
00195     cout << "NEIGHBORHOOD CONNECTIVITY: " << endl;
00196     //-------------- PRINT CELLS TO CELLS ----------------//
00197     celIt = _cells.begin();
00198     
00199     while (celIt != _cells.end()) {
00200         cout << " CELL " << celIt->first << ": ";
00201 
00202         // query cell for surface pointers
00203         const QASVec& boundingSurfaces = celIt->second->getBoundingSurfaces();
00204 
00205         QASVec::const_iterator bsIt = boundingSurfaces.begin();
00206 
00207         while (bsIt != boundingSurfaces.end()) {
00208 
00209             _printQAS(*bsIt);
00210             cout << ":{";
00211 
00212             const CellVec& otherCells =
00213                 celIt->second->getNeighbors(bsIt->first);
00214 
00215             CellVec::const_iterator outCelIt = otherCells.begin();
00216 
00217             while (outCelIt != otherCells.end()) {
00218                 cout << (*outCelIt)->getUserId() << " ";
00219 
00220                 ++outCelIt;
00221             }
00222             cout << "} ";
00223             ++bsIt;
00224         }
00225 
00226         cout << endl;
00227         ++celIt;
00228     }  
00229 }

00231 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00232 void MCGeometry::_printQAS(const QuadricAndSense& qas) const
00233 {
00234     if (qas.second == true)
00235         cout << "+";
00236     else
00237         cout << "-";
00238 
00239     SurfaceUserIdMap::const_iterator findResult = _surfaceIds.find(qas.first);
00240     Require(findResult != _surfaceIds.end());
00241     // print the "value" corresponding to the key (i.e. unsigned int)
00242     cout << findResult->second;
00243 }
00244 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00245 MCGeometry::~MCGeometry()
00246 {
00247     // clean up after ourselves
00248     
00249 
00250     SurfaceMap::iterator itSur = _surfaces.begin();
00251     
00252     while (itSur != _surfaces.end()) {
00253         // delete the surface to which the iterator points
00254         delete itSur->second;
00255 
00256         ++itSur;
00257     }
00258     
00259     CellMap::iterator celIt = _cells.begin();
00260     
00261     while (celIt != _cells.end()) {
00262         // delete the cell to which the iterator points
00263         delete celIt->second;
00264 
00265         ++celIt;
00266     }
00267 }
